div.h3: What our customers say about us!

div.p:
With Sagepay
handling our
online payments, you can be assured that your details will be safe. Payments can also be made by calling us on 02074350941, by bank transfer or cheque.

Our team of
dedicated professional advisers offer outstanding service and we pride ourselves on being able to support our customers from the purchasing stage, installation and servicing and throughout the life of your products.

We check our
prices regularly
against major retailers so you can buy from Wheelbase with confidence - if you find it cheaper elsewhere we will do our best to match the Price if not beat it.

We're so
confident our
services will fit
your needs perfectly that we're offering you a 14 day money back guarantee, and if you don't fall in love with us, we'll give you your money back. No questions asked.

div.div: Buy Alloy Wheels from First Aid Wheels an official distributor of Alloys First Aid Wheels is the UK's number 1 Alloy Wheels Shop. Open 9am to 6pm Monday to Friday & 9am to 5:30pm Saturday. Full on Site fitting service available at our store in Manchester. Call our experts on 07912760161 or contact us.

div.p: At First Aid Wheels we are able to supply budget, mid-range and high-end tyres to meet your needs. You are more than welcome to come to our garage and get your tyres inspected. We will always make sure, that your tyres are safe and legal to drive.

We offer a personal, reliable and friendly service. Our team is highly qualified with many years' epxerience in the tyres and wheels industry. We use the best machines on the market, which are systematically checked, tested and calibrated
Our goal is to find the best solution for you and your car.

Please remember, that the legal limit for minimum depth of the tread on your tyres is 1.6 mm. For safety reasons it is recommended that you replace your tyres before the legal limit is reached. At 1.6 mm in wet weather it takes an extra 8 meters car length to stop at 50 mph than if your tread was 3 mm. A regular check of your tyres will help you to avoid 3 penalty points and £2.500 in fines (per tyre)
Please call us on  0207 4350 941 to get a quote.
Would you like to have your wheels refurbished/repaired, but you don’t have time to bring them to us? Here is a solution.
Now we are offering door-to-door collection & delivery service, which starts at £34.99 (one way for set of four wheels)

Contact us via email or phone to obtain a quotation.Once you’ll accept it, we will take care of the rest (please, make sure, that the wheels are taken off the car and prepared to be collected by the courier

As soon as we receive them, they will be professionally inspected and we will contact you if additional charges applies (e.g. cracks, buckles or bad corrosion). Once detailed quotation is accepted, we will start full refurbishment/repair process.

Usually it takes up to 7 working days, but sometimes it might take a bit longer (depending on e.g. condition of your wheels or special/custom finish). We will contact you to book delivery date that suits you best.

div.p:
30-day money-back guarantee
Free Shipping in U.S.
Buy now, get in 2 days

We have two different refurbishing processes to offer our customers. The first option is full factory refurbishment where the wheels are completely refurbished with a powder coating to the original finish; this is the same method as used in a wheel factory. This is the best way to refurbish a wheel due to the high quality of the finish and the fact that the whole wheel has been refurbished, this process is highly recommended.
The second process is cosmetic repair for wheels with minor scrapes. The process is very quick as the smart repair is localised to one section of the wheel or face.

If we have the car on site it will be parked within our secure premises for the duration of the repair. The other option is that spare wheels are temporally fitted so that the car can stay on the road.
div.h5: 2) Removing old tyres, balance weights & valves
div.p: The tyres are removed from the wheels and marked for precision & rotation, and tagged with the customer’s name. (If we spot unsafe tyres we will draw this to your attention. We reserve the right to refuse to refit tyres which are deemed to be unsafe. You are welcome to provide your own replacement tyre, or we can supply a replacement at competitive prices). We then remove all balance weights, valves & sensors (if required). The wheel is then inspected for visual damage such as dents, buckles and cracks.
The wheel is then dipped in a special chemical solution to strip away the existing finish and break all dust. After a few hours the entire wheel is fully stripped back to bare aluminium.
The wheel is then sand blasted in a special blasting cabinet for final cleaning and corrosion removal.

Once the wheel is fully cleaned it is much easier to see if there are any cracks or structural damage. The wheels are then tested on a balancing machine to check for any bends or buckles. At this stage we will notify you if there is any damage to the wheel deemed to be dangerous, and advise if the wheel can be repaired and if any extra repair cost is involved.

We have advanced techniques in the straightening of bent, buckled & dented alloy wheels. We utilise special machinery to straighten the wheel, specially designed for that purpose. The refurbishment is not always necessary when straightening the wheel. If the damage is only small and on the inside of the rim, then we can repair just that area rather than the full refurbishment.
The next step is selective machining to remove all kerb damage from the surface of the wheel (if the damage is very deep it can be filled with aluminium and welded to return it to its original shape)

- First the wheel is placed into the oven for the pre heating process. After this new powder primer is applied
- After the powder is applied the wheels go back into the oven for the curing process.
- After the curing process the wheels are allowed to cool down slightly before the colour application and powder coat clear lacquer.
-The wheels are then taken placed back into the oven to harden the coatings and ensure a full cure.

Once the wheel is repaired we fit new rubber valves (if the wheels had metal valves or sensors these are re-fitted as before). The tyre is then refitted to the wheel and balanced using weights stuck to the inside of the wheel.
The wheels are fitted to the car and final checks are carried out including tyre pressure and wheel bolt torque and tightening.
-Painting a small area of the wheel where damage has occurred to the surface.
If you are not sure what is best for your wheels we advise you to contact us or visit our workshop to discuss the problems with the wheels. Remember it doesn’t cost you anything to ask.
We recognise that while you can put your car through an automated wash, use sophisticated polishes to keep the bodywork gleaming, wheels, especially alloy wheels take a lot of punishment.

There is only one winner when you scrape your alloys against a kerb. Dust from brake pads mixed with a cocktail of water and oil as you drive along, creates a face-pack you often cannot completely clean off. So, the car you take pride in looks less than.
Elsewhere we tell you what we do to redress that. There’s also a Question and Answer section for your questions about Alloy Wheels Exchange and how we work.

But, who are we? In 2001 we recognised that as car design became ever more sophisticated, there was a desire to have alloy wheels that complemented this. So, we offered drivers a customising service to reflect the personality of their car.

Drivers recognised what we offered was special. It was also highly cost effective compared to buying a new, off-the-shelf set of five wheels. Over a decade we continued to invest in the most up-to-date machining and profiling technology. Paint systems that enabled us to match the manufacturer’s original finish.

Be advised not all companies offer the level of skill and service that we do. We take no short cuts. Quality is our mantra. We go the extra mile and are confident in guaranteeing our work. Our customers tell us how pleased they are. We feel confident that when you exchange your alloy wheels with us you will also be more than pleased.

p.span: This service is convenient for customers and for us, unfortunately the success of this program relies on customers fully understanding what we have on offer.

We offer refurbished alloy wheels on a like for like basis, which means you have to give us back the same wheels you want from us. Please read the advert… read it fully and it will explain how our service works.

You are not buying wheels outright or upgrading your small wheels to bigger ones… you are simply exchanging your old kerbed and tired wheels on like for like basis for our factoty refurbished set that was fully striped and powder coat painted with top coat of a super durable acrylic lacquer baked in the oven at high temperature.

h2.span: The exchange service works as follows:

p.span: 1. We remove your existing wheels and check that there are no buckles/cracks or previous welds.  Sizes and offsets will be checked to make sure fitments are 100% the same.
2. We then fit and balance your existing tyres onto our refurbished wheels and refit them onto your car.
3. Your existing wheels then stay with us.

As we will be fitting your part worn tyres we will check for any damage or wear and advise if necessary, new tyres can be supplied if arranged in advance and this will provide even greater cost savings (our fitting and balancing costs are already included in the exchange/refurbishment service.)
The new refurbished wheels comes with a 1 year guarantee on the work (please see our terms and conditions at www.fawheels.co.uk for the guarantee on our work and the finish)
Please check a selection of the wheels that we have on offer.  Our database of wheel sets are changing constantly.

If you can't find your wheels for exchange, don't worry, we can refurbish your own set and in most cases You don't have to leave your car on site, why?..., because we can fit spare wheels on your vehicle, so you can stay on the road, while we refurbishing yours.

p.strong: FAWHEELS prices start from £55.00 (plus VAT) per wheel for a full factory refurbishment. Our prices are based upon; the wheel size, the level of damage, colour, the number of wheels, whether the wheels are supplied with or without tyres, if your car is to be left on site, plus any additional work required such as; straightening, welding, bespoke and customised work. All prices quoted exclude VAT. E & O E

p.strong: Our standard colors includes a wide range of silvers, anthracites, gloss & matt black, metalic black and white

h4.a: Wheels with Tyres (click here to see prices)

tr.td: You bring your wheels with tyres. This service includes full factory refurbishment. Refitting of tyres, new valves and balancing.

tr.td: You bring your car, we take of everything! This service includes full factory refurbishment. refitting of tyres, new valves, balancing, refitting wheels with correct tyre pressure and wheel bolts torque. * Donor wheels subject to availability

div.strong: Price from £90 per wheel. Please call us to discuss your exact requirements or send email with photos to info@fawheels.co.uk to get a quote.

h4.a: Other Services (click here to see prices)

div.strong: Smart repair is usually quicker than full refurb and can be done to the wheel in overall good condition with minor damage. Repair of small scrapes and scratches to the section of the wheel from £50+vat or Diamond Cut face of the wheel without the full process from £70+vat. Please call for more details or email/text(07966170469) photo to get a quote.

div.div: Prices exclude VAT and are correct as of May 1st, 2014
